titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) Gubernatorial records, Press Office, Series 25
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, Press Office, Series 25 FA368

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 13:36:24 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller gubernatorial records, Press Office, Series 25

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is divided into 9 subseries:

Subseries 1 - Public Relations Files Subseries 2 - Latin American Mission Subseries 3 - Agency and Commission Reports Subseries 4 - Positions and Policy Papers Subseries 5 - Political and Election Analysis Files Subseries 6 - County Visits Subseries 7 - Recommendations to Fill U.S. Senate Seat Following Robert F. Kennedy's Assassination, 1968 Subseries 8 - Miscellaneous Subseries 9 - Statements and Press Releases

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The material in this series was created and maintained by Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller's Press Office. The series includes copies of press releases documenting his governmental and political activities and some background material used in the creation of the releases. Also included is a small collection of statistical analysis reports used by the Governor's office to gauge public opinion on various issues.

did.unittitle: Public Relations File

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of press releases documenting the activities of the four Rockefeller Administrations (January 1, 1959 - December 18, 1973). The releases include announcements concerning appointments, new state programs, legislation initiated, signed or vetoed by the Governor, the Governor's reaction to major events, and other official statements and proclamations. Also included are complete transcripts and abbreviated summaries of the Governor's speeches, travel itineraries and schedules of appearances provided for the benefit of the press, and transcripts of Governor Rockefeller's Town Meetings. The Town Meetings were public forums designed to provide greater exposure for the Governor and his initiatives. They were held throughout the state in 1967, 1969, and 1972.

An incomplete collection of press releases from Rockefeller's 1958 gubernatorial campaign is also included here. There are also press releases and speech transcripts from Rockefeller's campaigns for the Republican nomination in the presidential elections of 1960, 1964, and 1968.

This file continues past Gov. Rockefeller's resignation December 18, 1973. The post-gubernatorial releases are transcripts of interviews, press conferences, and speeches. Topics covered during this period include the privately funded Commission on Critical Choices (of which he was the chairman), Watergate, and his appointment as vice president. The last press release in this series is dated October 16, 1974.
The Public Relations Files is not an entirely complete collection of Governor Rockefeller's press releases. A subject index is available. While it, too, has been proven incomplete, it is usable.

did.unittitle: Latin American Mission

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subseries 2 is a collection of daily releases issued during Rockefeller's Presidential Mission to Latin America in 1969. At the request of President Richard M. Nixon, Rockefeller consulted with the leaders of 20 Latin American republics to solicit their opinion concerning U.S. inter-American policies and to determine the needs and conditions of the countries. The visits were made over the course of four separate trips. The bulk of the material in this subseries is transcripts of Rockefeller's speeches delivered during the trips. Also included are lists and resumes of the 36 advisors of the Governor's testimony on his findings and recommendations before the House Subcommittee on Inter-American Affairs and the Senate Subcommittee on Western Hemisphere Affairs.

did.unittitle: Agency and Commission Reports

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: These reports are arranged chronologically by the date of their release to the press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subseries 3 is a collection of 371 reports issued by New York State agencies and commissions. Related press releases are filed with many of the reports. These reports were presumably filed in the Press Office so that the Press Office staff could prepare press releases for them and could answer questions from the public concerning the report or related programs.

Positions and Policy Papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subseries 4 consists of press releases and background files concerning Governor Rockefeller's stand on various issues. Prepared primarily for the 1964 and 1968 presidential campaigns, this files in this subseries also include information on other candidates' positions on the issues. There is also a 1968 staff recommendation for the Governor's position on domestic issues and a 1973 summary of his positions on major issues throughout his 15 years as governor.

did.unittitle: Available Speech Material, Book 1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, policy statements and drafts of speeches which were prepared for use in the California Presidential Campaign, but were never used.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subseries 6 documents Governor Rockefeller's tours of New York in 1962. The material includes press releases, speech transcripts, and itineraries provided to the press, as well as background information on local issues in each county prepared by the governor's staff in preparation for the tours.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Letters are arranged chronologically by the date they were replied to and alphabetically by the name of the person recommended thereunder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subseries 7 consists of letters from the public recommending various individuals to be appointed to fill New York State's U.S. Senate seat left vacant by the assassination of Robert F. Kennedy in June 1968.

did.unittitle: Statements and Press Releases

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Subseries 9 is arranged alphabetically by topic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subseries 9 is a collection of press releases documenting the activities of Governor Rockefeller's early tenure. The releases include announcements concerning appointments; new state programs; legislation initiated, signed, or vetoed by the Governor; the Governor's reaction to major events; and other official statements and proclamations.
